intro: Calonemorchis cairnsiana, commonly known as the Cairns' rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white and yellow, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
